div1.head: Letter from Clara Hepler to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter et al., April 29, 1917
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Cleveland, Ohio,
Apr-29-1917
Mrs. H. R. Carter
Baltimore Md.
My Dear Mrs Carter & All:-
div1.p:
Your letter
was such a pleasure to get, and
am going to try & send a few lines
in Return at once. Am sorry to hear
you are not very well. I sincerely
hope when the weather warms
up that you will be better, It sure
is lonesome to have Dr. Carter &
Miss Laura so far away from
you. But oh my Dear Mrs Carter you
have such look Care & Company having
2
Dr. Carter Jr. & Miss Mary Carter with
you, I sure shall never forget the
Kindness you all did for me during
my spell of illness there,

My Mother is here with me which
has been lovely for me as I have
not be so very well But glad to
say I am feeling real good now.
Have been doing quite a bit of
sewing & been out planting
flowers & some Veg,. Sewing This
spring has been lightened a great
deal, by we getting a New Machine
and an Electric Motor to run
same, and I have found same
a Wanderful help to me, Being
Mamma & Little Bernice are here
I have extra sewing as I want
to have their sewing all done before
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
3
They leave for Wisconsin, I find it a
great pleasure to think I am given
strenght to be able to do same,
Mamma has not been well at all of
late, And of course Life has been
made very Lonely for her.

But how sad & dark it is made for
us, we must try and think it
is all done for the best,
Mr Heplers Mother Died the first
of Mar, so he was home for a week
and I sure was glad my Mother was
here at the time. so I was not alone
For it was so very cold in Wisconsin
Mr Hepler thought best for me not to
go with him, not being very well at that
time, Well we are having a real cool
4
Spring, I have planted sweet peas & they
are up But don't grow very fast being
so cool. We have a lot of Beds for flowers
here, next is what to plant in them.
Dr. Holt & Family do not live @ Hospital
So the flower planting is left to Mr:-
Hepler & myself, and we are going to
do the best we can. We have set out
quite a few “Rose bushes only hope
they will do well. And we have planted
Choice dwarf Nasturtimus as a border
around the Building, and have
ordered Started Cannas for two
large beds, and I have planted
several different Kinds of flower
seed in Hot house beds to be transplanted
and I have a Bed of Choice Pancies
which we were in town & got about
couple of weeks ago. But have had to
keep them covered the most of the time
so they wouldn't get chilled, Oh I watch
the seeds & all every day to see if they
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
5
show any signs of growing. We are
in hope that they will grow so we can
have a nice display of flowers,
We have a nice Cottage with front
and back porch which makes it
fine as I get out doors a lot,
and plenty of room, and we can
watch boats go & come as the Pier
is right near Hospital, If it were
not for the “Noisy trains” running
right back of Hospital this would
be a Beautiful place, But of course
the noise & smoke from the trains
make it a little disagreeable, But
We try and make the best of it,
This is a very dreary rainy day
so very gloomy out,

I do hope this will find you
and all quite well, With Kind
Regards & Love, I Remain
div1.closer:
As Ever Clara Hepler Mamma sends her Love to
You & Miss Mary Carter
